definitions.definition: An act or episode of rescuing, saving.
The forcible ending of a siege; liberation from similar military peril
definitions.example: The rescue of Jerusalem was the original motive of the Crusaders

definitions.definition: A special airliner flight to bring home passengers who are stranded

definitions.example: The dog was a rescue with some behavior issues.

definitions.definition: To save from any violence, danger or evil.
definitions.example: The well-trained team rescued everyone after the avalanche.

definitions.definition: To free or liberate from confinement or other physical restraint.
definitions.example: to rescue a prisoner from the enemy.

definitions.definition: To deliver by arms, notably from a siege.
To remove or withdraw from a state of exposure to evil and sin.
definitions.example: Traditionally missionaries aim to rescue many ignorant heathen souls.

definitions.definition: To achieve something positive under difficult conditions.
